It is not limited only to BPL families but covers a broader range of the underprivileged population. C. Smart card based Ayushman Bharat uses a smart card for accessing healthcare services. The card is used to avail benefits at empanelled hospitals, simplifying the process of treatment under the scheme. D. Is a type of insurance scheme Ayushman Bharat is indeed a health insurance scheme that provides coverage for hospitalization expenses. It is designed to reduce out-of-pocket expenditure for medical treatment and improve access to healthcare services for the underprivileged.

choices.text: Was launched on childrens day (14 november)
Objective is to reduce 2% per year Stunting & Under nutrition in children less than 6 years
Objective is to reduce 2% per year low birth weight in children less than 6 years
Objective is to reduce 3% per year anemia in young children

questions.text: Which of the following is not true regarding the programme shown?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Was launched on Children’s Day (14 November) – Incorrect The programme in question is likely POSHAN Abhiyaan (National Nutrition Mission), which was launched on 8th March 2018 (International Women’s Day), not on Children’s Day (14 November). Hence, option A is incorrect. Incorrect Options: B. Objective is to reduce 2% per year Stunting & Under-nutrition in children less than 6 years – Correct POSHAN Abhiyaan aims to reduce stunting and undernutrition by 2% per year among children under 6 years of age to improve their overall health and development. C. Objective is to reduce 2% per year low birth weight in children less than 6 years – Correct The program also targets reducing low birth weight by 2% per year, which is essential for improving neonatal and infant health outcomes. D. Objective is to reduce 3% per year anemia in young children – Correct Another key goal is to reduce anemia by 3% per year among young children, adolescent girls, and pregnant women, to combat widespread iron deficiency and malnutrition.

choices.text: This is only for BPL families
This scheme is under ministry of women and child development
Immunization of child is one of the key services provided
Adolescent girls are also beneficiaries of this scheme

questions.text: Which of the following is not true regarding the scheme shown?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) This is only for BPL families – Incorrect The scheme in question is likely the Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) or POSHAN Abhiyaan, which is not restricted to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families. It is meant for all eligible beneficiaries, irrespective of their economic status, though priority is often given to marginalized communities. Hence, option A is incorrect and the correct choice for this question. Incorrect Options: B. This scheme is under the Ministry of Women and Child Development The ICDS scheme is implemented under the Ministry of Women and Child Development (MWCD), which oversees nutrition and welfare programs for mothers and children. C. Immunization of child is one of the key services provided One of the six main services under ICDS includes immunization to protect children from vaccine-preventable diseases. This is done in coordination with the National Health Mission (NHM). D. Adolescent girls are also beneficiaries of this scheme The Scheme for Adolescent Girls (SAG), earlier a part of ICDS, now functions under POSHAN Abhiyaan and focuses on nutrition, health, and life skills for adolescent girls aged 11-18 years.

choices.text: Free child care up to 28 days

questions.text: Image shown is related to
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Labour room quality. The image shown is likely related to ensuring quality care in the labour room, which is a critical aspect of maternal and neonatal health. Labour room quality focuses on factors such as infection prevention, skilled birth attendance, availability of essential equipment, respectful maternity care, and adherence to protocols for safe childbirth. Many global and national health programs, including WHO’s Quality of Care Framework and India’s LaQshya (Labour Room Quality Improvement Initiative), emphasize the importance of maintaining high standards in labour rooms to reduce maternal and neonatal mortality. Incorrect Options: (A) Giving incentive for institutional delivery – Incorrect While programs like Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY) provide financial incentives to encourage institutional deliveries, they focus on increasing the number of hospital births rather than directly improving labour room quality. The image is more likely related to labour room standards rather than financial incentives. (C) Free delivery – Incorrect Many governments offer free delivery services, such as Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram (JSSK) in India, to ensure that pregnant women receive free medical care. However, the image does not necessarily depict cost-free childbirth services but rather focuses on labour room quality and standards. (D) Free child care up to 28 days – Incorrect While some schemes, such as JSSK, provide free healthcare for newborns up to 28 days, this is a postnatal care initiative rather than a labour room quality improvement program. The image more likely highlights labour room protocols and standards rather than newborn care services after discharge.
